page.title: 09NEWTON VILLAGE MEETING.
page.content: Too small for a parish council,we have a Village Meeting formed in 1983 and with a chairman who attends County Council meetings in a non-voting capacity.All villagers are eligible to attend but the older residents are reluctant to do so without a great deal of persuasion.All opinions are canvassed and put to the meeting and it is often the views of the older residents which direct our decisions. The Meeting maintains dialoque with the estate to monitor or discuss any changes or any common problems.It deals with District Council proposals and directives.It organises fund- raising activities and the various rotas which operate to maintain the village as the inhabitants wish it to be.
